content.description:
This is one of the better routes at Manassa and was named after Jack Dempsey, the most famous person from Manassa.

The first pitch is a great warm-up (5.8) with a comfortable belay ledge.

The second pitch starts with thin face and goes to steep, bucket hauling face and ends with technical climbing.
content.protection: The first pitch takes 5 bolts and anchor. The second pitch 9 bolts and anchor. From the top anchor, rappel twice or rappel with two ropes to the ground. The route is 140 feet long.
content.location: As you walk up to the lower wall (10 minutes), the route is the second bolted route right (20 feet) of the only tree on the lower face.

content.description:
This climb was named after the late Jim DiNapoli. We think he would highly approve. The climb is on white rock, and we thought it's not pigeon shit, it reminds you of climbing in the Garden Of The Gods, Jim's favorite climbing area.

The crux is at the top of the climb and seems like an impossible overhang, but there's a bolt just before starting the crux and the holds are big.
content.protection: Pitch 1 has 3 bolts and an anchor. Pitch 2 has 9 bolts and an anchor.
content.location: The route is on the far right side of the Robust Wall. Start the route on the right side of the obvious white streak (5.6).The left side of the water streak goes to the same anchor and is also 5.6 At the first belay start climbing up and right following bolts to the overhang up and right (5.10a).
